chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
f: R -> R
n: nat
l: R
x: R

Goal:
is_derive_n f n x l -> Derive_n f n x = l

Premises:
Derive_n = fix Derive_n (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R) {struct n} : R := match n with | 0%nat => f x | S n0 => Derive (Derive_n f n0) x end : (R -> R) -> nat -> R -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope R_scope]
*** [ R : Set ]
is_derive_n = fun (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x l : R) => match n with | 0%nat => f x = l | S n0 => is_derive (Derive_n f n0) x l end : (R -> R) -> nat -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope R_scope R_scope]
Record family : Type := mkfamily { ind : R -> Prop; f : R -> R -> Prop; cond_fam : forall x : R, (exists y : R, f x y) -> ind x } For mkfamily: Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope function_scope]
ValAdh_un_exists : forall un : nat -> R, let D := fun x : R => exists n : nat, x = INR n in let f := fun x : R => adherence (fun y : R => (exists p : nat, y = un p /\ x <= INR p) /\ D x) in forall x : R, (exists y : R, f x y) -> D x
mkfamily : forall (ind : R -> Prop) (f : R -> R -> Prop), (forall x : R, (exists y : R, f x y) -> ind x) -> family
ValAdh_un = fun un : nat -> R => let D := fun x : R => exists n : nat, x = INR n in let f := fun x : R => adherence (fun y : R => (exists p : nat, y = un p /\ x <= INR p) /\ D x) in intersection_family {| ind := D; f := f; cond_fam := ValAdh_un_exists un |} : (nat -> R) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
constant_D_eq = fun (f : R -> R) (D : R -> Prop) (c : R) => forall x : R, D x -> f x = c : (R -> R) -> (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope R_scope]
Pser = fun (An : nat -> R) (x l : R) => infinite_sum (fun n : nat => An n * x ^ n) l : (nat -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
RList_P12 : forall (l : Rlist) (i : nat) (f : R -> R), (i < Rlength l)%nat -> pos_Rl (app_Rlist l f) i = f (pos_Rl l i)
sum_f_R0 = fix sum_f_R0 (f : nat -> R) (N : nat) {struct N} : R := match N with | 0%nat => f 0%nat | S i => sum_f_R0 f i + f (S i) end : (nat -> R) -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope]
ex_derive_n = fun (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R_AbsRing) => match n with | 0%nat => True | S n0 => ex_derive (Derive_n f n0) x end : (R -> R) -> nat -> R_AbsRing -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope _]
co_interval = fun a b x : R => a <= x < b : R -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope R_scope]
StepFun_P38 : forall (l : Rlist) (a b : R) (f : R -> R), ordered_Rlist l -> pos_Rl l 0 = a -> pos_Rl l (Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l)) = b -> {g : StepFun a b | g b = f b /\ (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l))%nat -> constant_D_eq g (co_interval (pos_Rl l i) (pos_Rl l (S i))) (f (pos_Rl l i)))}
seq.last_map : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : list T1) (x : T1), seq.last (f x) (seq.map f s) = f (seq.last x s)
AlembertC3_step1 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), x <> 0 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
ex_derive = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (f : K -> V) (x : K) => exists l : V, is_derive f x l : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (K -> V) -> K -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope _]
R_dist = fun x y : R => Rabs (x - y) : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
sigma_eq_arg : forall (f : nat -> R) (low : nat), sigma f low low = f low
seq.size_mkseq : forall (T : Type) (f : nat -> T) (n : nat), seq.size (seq.mkseq f n) = n
Alembert_C3 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
completeness : forall E : R -> Prop, bound E -> (exists x : R, E x) -> {m : R | is_lub E m}
adherence = fun (D : R -> Prop) (x : R) => point_adherent D x : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
AlembertC3_step2 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), x = 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
tech12 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x l : R), Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 (fun i : nat => An i * x ^ i) N) l -> Pser An x l
nfloor_ex : forall x : R, 0 <= x -> {n : nat | INR n <= x < INR n + 1}
sigma = fun (f : nat -> R) (low high : nat) => sum_f_R0 (fun k : nat => f (low + k)%nat) (high - low) : (nat -> R) -> nat -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope nat_scope]
Rlt_pow : forall (x : R) (n m : nat), 1 < x -> (n < m)%nat -> x ^ n < x ^ m
seq.nth_mkseq : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (f : nat -> T) (n i : nat), is_true (ssrnat.leq (S i) n) -> seq.nth x0 (seq.mkseq f n) i = f i
Rinv_pow : forall (x : R) (n : nat), x <> 0 -> / x ^ n = (/ x) ^ n
pow_nonzero : forall (x : R) (n : nat), x <> 0 -> x ^ n <> 0
pow_lt : forall (x : R) (n : nat), 0 < x -> 0 < x ^ n
FEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> FExpr C -> R

```coq
unfold Derive_n, is_derive_n. simpl.
destruct n as [| n0].
- reflexivity.
- intros H. rewrite <- IHn0. rewrite <- Derive_n_Derive. auto.
Qed.

original: unfold Derive_n, is_derive_n. simpl. destruct n as [| n0]. - reflexivity. - intros H. rewrite <- IHn0. rewrite <- Derive_n_Derive. auto.
